Class java.Nutmeg.IndexedCollection

  Class java.Nutmeg.IndexedCollection



java.lang.Object
   |
   +----java.Nutmeg.Collection
           |
           +----java.Nutmeg.IndexedCollection






  
 public class IndexedCollection
  
 extends Collection


Copyright (c) 1995, 1996 THOUGHT Inc. All Rights Reserved.

IndexedCollection class (a growable array).

A Collection sub class which is indexable, both by using the object
as a key, and by the location in the collection.





  




  
 
	IndexedCollection(int, int)
  
 Constructor for IndexedCollection with an initial storage capacity
and a specified growSize.
  
 
	IndexedCollection(int)
  
 Constructs an empty IndexedCollection with the specified storage 
capacity, and a default capacity increment.
  
 
	IndexedCollection()
  
 Construct an empty IndexedCollection.




  




  
 
	atAll(Collection, Object)
  
 Searches for the specified objects in aCollection, and replaces them
with copies of anObject.
  
 
	atAllPut(Object)
  
 Replaces all objects in this Collection with copies of anObject.
  
 
	checkIndex(int)
  
 Replaces all objects in this Collection with copies of anObject.
  
 
	clone()
  
 Clone this IndexedCollection.
  
 
	copyFrom(int, int)
  
 Copy objects with range of startPos and stopPos, and return them inside a
new Collection.
  
 
	copyReplaceFrom(int, int, Collection)
  
 Create a new collection with the objects between startPos and stopPos
replaced with the contents of aCollection.
  
 
	copyWith(Object)
  
 Create a new Collection with all of the original objects and anObject
added to it.
  
 
	copyWithout(Object)
  
 Create a new Collection with all of the original objects excluding 
the first Object that equals anObject, if any exist.
  
 
	findFirst(DoBlock)
  
 Find the first object which causes a true condition when passed to
doBlock for execution.
  
 
	findFirst(DoBlock, DoBlock)
  
 Find the first object which causes a true condition when passed to
doBlock for execution.
  
 
	findLast(DoBlock)
  
 Find the last object which causes a true condition when passed to
doBlock for execution.
  
 
	findLast(DoBlock, DoBlock)
  
 Find the last object which causes a true condition when passed to
doBlock for execution.
  
 
	first()
  
 Find the first object in the Collection.
  
 
	grow()
  
 Grow the allocated memory by growSize.
  
 
	indexOfCollection(Collection)
  
 Return the position of the first occurrence of aCollection, if the
the Collection is not found - .
  
 
	last()
  
 Find the last object in the Collection.
  
 
	replaceFrom(int, int, Collection)
  
 Replace the objects between startPos and stopPos with the Objects of
aCollection

  
 
	replaceFromStarting(int, int, Collection, int)
  
 Replace the objects between startPos and stopPos with the Objects of
aCollection which begin at colStartPos within that collection.
  
 
	replaceFromWithObject(int, int, Object)
  
 Replace the objects between startPos and stopPos with anObject

  
 
	reverse()
  
 Return a copy of the Collection with it's Objects in reversed order.
  
 
	reverseDo(DoBlock)
  
 Execute the doBlock on each Object in the Collection, starting with
the last element, and going in reverse order to the beginning Object.
  
 
	withDo(Collection, DoBlock)
  
 Evaluate doBlock with pairs of Objects as the argument, the first 
is taken from the current Collection, the other from aCollection.





  




IndexedCollection

  public IndexedCollection(int initialSize,
                           int growSize)




  
 Constructor for IndexedCollection with an initial storage capacity
and a specified growSize.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 initialSize - initial storage capacity of data storage
    
 growSize - the increment that storage should grow by
size doubles if value is 0.
  




IndexedCollection

  public IndexedCollection(int initialSize)




  
 Constructs an empty IndexedCollection with the specified storage 
capacity, and a default capacity increment.  Capacity increment 
is defaulted to 0 using this constructor.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 initialSize - initial storage capacity of data storage.
  




IndexedCollection

  public IndexedCollection()




  
 Construct an empty IndexedCollection.  This defaults to an initial 
storage capacity of 10 objects, and a growSize of 0.





  



atAll

  public final synchronized void atAll(Collection aCollection,
                                       Object anObject)




  
 Searches for the specified objects in aCollection, and replaces them
with copies of anObject.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 aCollection - The Collection containing objects to be replaced.
    
 anObject - the object to replace each matching object of the 
Collection with.
  




atAllPut

  public final synchronized void atAllPut(Object anObject)




  
 Replaces all objects in this Collection with copies of anObject.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anObject - the object to replace each object of the 
Collection with.
  




checkIndex

  public final boolean checkIndex(int anInt)




  
 Replaces all objects in this Collection with copies of anObject.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anInt - the object to replace each object of the 
Collection with.
    
 Returns:
    
 boolean True if anInteger is a valid index, false if not.
  




copyFrom

  public final synchronized Collection copyFrom(int startPos,
                                                int stopPos)




  
 Copy objects with range of startPos and stopPos, and return them inside a
new Collection.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 startPos - The beginning of the range to be copied.
    
 stopPos - The end of the range to be copied.
    
 Returns:
    
 Collection a Collection with a copy of each object between
the ranges of startPos and stopPos.  If ranges are invalid, then return
null, or do exception, depending on whether the Collection is
configured for Java or Smalltalk style error handling.
    
 Throws: NoSuchCollectionMember
    
 No collection member found which
matches the criteria.
  




copyReplaceFrom

  public final synchronized Collection copyReplaceFrom(int startPos,
                                                       int stopPos,
                                                       Collection aCollection)




  
 Create a new collection with the objects between startPos and stopPos
replaced with the contents of aCollection.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 startPos - The beginning of the range to be copied.
    
 stopPos - The end of the range to be copied.
    
 aCollection - The list of replacement Objects.
    
 Returns:
    
 Collection a Collection with the objects outside of the range,
as well as the replacement Objects between the ranges of startPos and 
stopPos.  If ranges are invalid, then return
null, or do exception, depending on whether the Collection is
configured for Java or Smalltalk style error handling.
    
 Throws: NoSuchCollectionMember
    
 No collection member found which
matches the criteria.
  




copyWith

  public final Collection copyWith(Object anObject)




  
 Create a new Collection with all of the original objects and anObject
added to it.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anObject - The object to be added to the collection.
    
 Returns:
    
 Collection The new collection with anObject added.
  




copyWithout

  public final Collection copyWithout(Object anObject)




  
 Create a new Collection with all of the original objects excluding 
the first Object that equals anObject, if any exist.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anObject - The object to be added to the collection.
    
 Returns:
    
 Collection The new collection with anObject added.
  




findFirst

  public final int findFirst(DoBlock doBlock)




  
 Find the first object which causes a true condition when passed to
doBlock for execution.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 doBlock - The block to execute.
    
 Returns:
    
 int Position of the first object to cause a true return code
as a parameter to doBlock.  If none cause a true return, then return
a -1 value.
  




findFirst

  public final int findFirst(DoBlock doBlock,
                             DoBlock errorBlock)




  
 Find the first object which causes a true condition when passed to
doBlock for execution.  If no Objects cause doBlock to return true
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 doBlock - The block to execute.
    
 errorBlock - The error block to execute if not Objects found.
    
 Returns:
    
 int Position of the first object to cause a true return code
as a parameter to doBlock.  If none cause a true return, then return
a -1 value.
  




findLast

  public final int findLast(DoBlock doBlock)




  
 Find the last object which causes a true condition when passed to
doBlock for execution.  If no Objects cause doBlock to return true,
then -1 is returned.
This is implemented by starting at the end of the list and working
backwards, so please do not build any accumulation logic into
doBlock.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 doBlock - The block to execute.
    
 Returns:
    
 int Position of the first object to cause a true return code
as a parameter to doBlock.  If none cause a true return, then return
a -1 value.
  




findLast

  public final int findLast(DoBlock doBlock,
                            DoBlock notFoundBlock)




  
 Find the last object which causes a true condition when passed to
doBlock for execution.  If no Objects cause doBlock to return true,
notFoundBlock is executed, then -1 is returned.
This is implemented by starting at the end of the list and working
backwards, so please do not build any accumulation logic into
doBlock.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 doBlock - The block to execute.
    
 notFoundBlock - The block to execute if no Objects return true
from doBlock.
    
 Returns:
    
 int Position of the first object to cause a true return code
as a parameter to doBlock.  If none cause a true return, then return
a -1 value.
    
 Throws: NoSuchCollectionMember
    
 No collection member found which
matches the criteria.
  




first

  public final Object first()




  
 Find the first object in the Collection.
  

    
 Returns:
    
 Object The first Object in the Collection, null is returned if
the Collection is empty.
    
 Throws: NoSuchCollectionMember
    
 No collection member found which
matches the criteria.
  




grow

  public final void grow()




  
 Grow the allocated memory by growSize.



indexOfCollection

  public final int indexOfCollection(Collection aCollection)




  
 Return the position of the first occurrence of aCollection, if the
the Collection is not found - .
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 aCollection - The collection to find.
    
 Returns:
    
 int Position of the first occurrence of aCollection.  If
java style exceptions are turned on, we throw an exception if not
found, otherwise we return a -1 value.
    
 Throws: NoSuchCollectionMember
    
 No collection member found which
matches the criteria.
  




last

  public final Object last()




  
 Find the last object in the Collection.
  

    
 Returns:
    
 Object The last Object in the Collection, null is returned if
the Collection is empty, unless java exceptions are turned on.
    
 Throws: NoSuchCollectionMember
    
 No collection member found which
matches the criteria.
  




replaceFrom

  public final synchronized void replaceFrom(int startPos,
                                             int stopPos,
                                             Collection aCollection)




  
 Replace the objects between startPos and stopPos with the Objects of
aCollection
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 startPos - The starting position to begin replacing.
    
 stopPos - The last position to be replaced.
    
 aCollection - The collection to place into the position where
we removed Objects.
  




replaceFromStarting

  public final synchronized void replaceFromStarting(int startPos,
                                                     int stopPos,
                                                     Collection aCollection,
                                                     int colStartPos)




  
 Replace the objects between startPos and stopPos with the Objects of
aCollection which begin at colStartPos within that collection.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 startPos - The starting position to begin replacing.
    
 stopPos - The last position to be replaced.
    
 aCollection - The collection to place into the position where
we removed Objects.
    
 colStartPos - Beginning position of Objects to be used to
replace the removed Objects.
    
 Throws: NoSuchCollectionMember
    
 No collection member found which
matches the criteria.
  




replaceFromWithObject

  public final synchronized void replaceFromWithObject(int startPos,
                                                       int stopPos,
                                                       Object anObject)




  
 Replace the objects between startPos and stopPos with anObject
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 startPos - The starting position to begin replacing.
    
 stopPos - The last position to be replaced.
    
 anObject - The Object to replace those removed.
    
 Throws: NoSuchCollectionMember
    
 No collection member found which
matches the criteria.
  




reverse

  public final synchronized Collection reverse()




  
 Return a copy of the Collection with it's Objects in reversed order.



reverseDo

  public final synchronized void reverseDo(DoBlock doBlock)




  
 Execute the doBlock on each Object in the Collection, starting with
the last element, and going in reverse order to the beginning Object.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 doBlock - The block to execute on each Object in the Collection.
  




withDo

  public final synchronized void withDo(Collection aCollection,
                                        DoBlock doBlock)




  
 Evaluate doBlock with pairs of Objects as the argument, the first 
is taken from the current Collection, the other from aCollection.
WARNING!
This method will only operate on Collections of the same size!
If they are not the same size, the method simply returns.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 aCollection - The collection with the other half of the elements
to operate on.
    
 doBlock - The block to execute on each Object in the Collection.
  




clone

  public synchronized Object clone()




  
 Clone this IndexedCollection. The objects are not cloned.
  

    
 Overrides:
    
 clone in class Collection
